New Records: Mohammad Rizwan became the fastest player to score 3,000 T20I runs
Key Match Events: Saim Ayub got out on the second ball of the innings scoring just four runs
Babar Azam followed Saim Ayub in the fifth over after contributing just 14 runs
Usman Khan was clean bowled by Ish Sodhi for just seven runs
Shaheen Afridi sent the Black Caps' opener, Tim Seifert, back to the pavilion for just 12 runs
Mohammad Amir removed Tim Robinson for just four runs
Abrar Ahmed took two quick wickets in the ninth over, sending Mark Chapman and James Neesham back to the pavilion
Shadab Khan and Naseem Shah helped dominate New Zealand's batting lineup
Afridi picked three wickets, while Amir, Abrar, and Shadab got two each
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan now leads the five-match series 1-0
The first T20I was called off due to rain
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan's bowling attack bundled out the entire New Zealand side for 90 runs in 18.1 overs
The Black Caps were never in the game as they were troubled greatly by the Pakistani pace attack
Pakistan won by seven wickets chasing the target of 91
